test-case.name: switch-001
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $animal as xs:string := "Cat"; <out>{ switch ($animal) case "Cow" return "Moo" case "Cat" return "Meow" case "Duck" return "Quack" default return "What's that odd noise?" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-002
test-case.description: basic switch example, matches default clause
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $animal as xs:string := "Dog"; <out>{ switch ($animal) case "Cow" return "Moo" case "Cat" return "Meow" case "Duck" return "Quack" default return "What's that odd noise?" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-003
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $animal as xs:string := "!?!?"; <out>{ switch (upper-case($animal)) case "COW" return "Moo" case "CAT" return "Meow" case "DUCK" return "Quack" case lower-case($animal) return "Oink" default return "What's that odd noise?" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-004
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $animal as xs:string := "goose"; <out>{ switch (upper-case($animal)) case "COW" return "Moo" case "CAT" return "Meow" case "DUCK" case "GOOSE" return "Quack" case "PIG" case "SWINE" return "Oink" default return "What's that odd noise?" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-005
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $animal as xs:string := "duck"; <out>{ switch (upper-case($animal)) case "COW" return "Moo" case "CAT" return "Meow" case "DUCK" case "GOOSE" return "Quack" case "PIG" case "SWINE" return "Oink" default return "What's that odd noise?" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-006
test-case.description: switch test, numeric case clauses, no type error

test-case.name: switch-007
test-case.description: switch test, untypedAtomic is converted to string
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := 42; { switch ($in) case 42 return "Moo" case "42" return "Meow" case 42e0 return "Quack" case "42e0" return "Oink" default return "Expletive deleted" }

test-case.name: switch-008
test-case.description: switch test, untypedAtomic is converted to string
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := "42"; { switch ($in) case 42 return "Moo" case 42 return "Meow" case 42e0 return "Quack" case "42e0" return "Oink" default return "Expletive deleted" }

test-case.name: switch-009
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := (); { switch ($in) case 42 return "Moo" case 42 return "Meow" case 42e0 return "Quack" case "42e0" return "Oink" case () return "Woof" default return "Expletive deleted" }

test-case.name: switch-010
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := 21; { switch ($in) case 42 return "Moo" case 42 return "Meow" case 42e0 return "Quack" case "42e0" return "Oink" case () return "Woof" default return "Expletive deleted" }

test-case.name: switch-011
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := xs:double('NaN'); { switch ($in) case 42 return "Moo" case 42 return "Meow" case 42e0 return "Quack" case "42e0" return "Oink" case xs:float('NaN') return "Woof" default return "Expletive deleted" }

test-case.name: switch-012
switch-013
switch-014
switch-015
switch-016
test-case.description: switch test, xs:date value one with timezone

test-case.name: switch-017
test-case.description: switch test, xs:dateTime value one with timezone

test-case.name: switch-018
test-case.description: switch test, xs:time value both with timezone

test-case.name: switch-019
test-case.test: let $v := parse-xml("<switch>2</switch>") return $v//switch

test-case.name: switch-020
test-case.test: parse-xml("<switch>2</switch>") ! (switch (switch) case '2' return 2 default return 1)

test-case.name: switch-401
test-case.description: switch, case operand >1 item, allowed in 4.0
test-case.test: declare variable $in external := 2; switch ($in) case 1 return "Moo" case 5 return "Meow" case 3 return "Quack" case ($in to 4) return "Oink" default return "Baa"

test-case.name: switch-402
test-case.test: declare variable $in external := 6; switch ($in) case 1 return "Moo" case 5 return "Meow" case 3 return "Quack" case ($in to 4) return "Oink" default return "Baa"

test-case.name: switch-403
switch-404
test-case.test: declare variable $in := (1 to 20)[year-from-date(current-date()) idiv 1000 = .]; <out>{ switch (head($in)) case 1 return "Moo" case 5 to 10 return "Meow" case 3 return "Quack" case () return "Empty" case ("a", "b", true(), 2) return "Oink" default return "Baa" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-405
switch-406
test-case.description: switch example with omitted comparand, using braces

test-case.name: switch-407
test-case.description: switch example with omitted comparand, sans braces
test-case.test: xquery version "4.0"; declare variable $animal as xs:string := "Cat"; switch case $animal eq "Cow" return "Moo" case $animal eq "Cat" return "Meow" case $animal eq "Duck" return "Quack" default return "What's that odd noise?"

test-case.name: switch-408
test-case.description: switch example with omitted comparand, sans braces, with a disorienting comment
test-case.test: xquery version "4.0"; declare variable $animal as xs:string := "Cat"; switch (:$animal:) case $animal eq "Cow" return "Moo" case $animal eq "Cat" return "Meow" case $animal eq "Duck" return "Quack" default return "What's that odd noise?"

test-case.name: switch-901
test-case.description: switch, type error, switch operand >1 item
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := 2; <out>{ switch (1 to $in) case 1 return "Moo" case 2 return "Meow" case 3 return "Quack" case 4 return "Oink" default return "Baa" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-902
test-case.description: switch, type error, case operand >1 item
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := 2; <out>{ switch ($in) case 1 return "Moo" case 5 return "Meow" case 3 return "Quack" case ($in to 4) return "Oink" default return "Baa" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-903
switch-904
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := 2; <out>{ switch ($in) case 1 return "Moo" case 5 return "Meow" case 3 return "Quack" case ($in to 4) return "Oink" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-905
test-case.description: switch, static error, empty case list
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := 2; <out>{ switch ($in) case 1 return "Moo" case 5 return "Meow" return "Quack" case ($in to 4) return "Oink" default return "Baa" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-906
test-case.description: switch, static error, not an ExprSingle
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := 2; <out>{ switch ($in) case 1 return "Moo", "Boo" case 5 return "Meow" case 7 return "Quack" case 4 return "Oink" default return "Baa" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-907
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := 2; <out>{ switch $in case 1 return "Moo", "Boo" case 5 return "Meow" case 7 return "Quack" case 4 return "Oink" default return "Baa" }</out>

test-case.name: switch-908
test-case.description: switch, static error, curlies not allowed

test-case.name: switch-909
test-case.description: switch, static error, colons not allowed
test-case.test: xquery version "3.0"; declare variable $in := 2; <out>{ switch ($in) case 1: return "Moo", "Boo" case 5: return "Meow" case 7: return "Quack" case 4: return "Oink" default: return "Baa" }</out>
